page.title: 07HISTORICAL NOTES WELBURY
page.content: Welbury was mentioned in the original Domesday Book as Welleburga.King John is reputed to have visited the village in 1199 to confirm the sale of land from Wm.Ingram of Welbury.Much of the area was destroyed by the Scots in 1319. By 1800 most of the land was owned by the 1st Earl of Harewood. This was gradually sold into private ownersip during the 20th.century.In 1850 the railway was opened, by 1900 there were 17 men working at the station and marshalling yard at the southern end of the village.All that remains now is a level crossing.The village inn is an eighteenth century building.After 30 years under the ownership of Mr.&Mrs.Bill Turnbull it has recently changed hands to Mr.& Mrs.J.D.Salton.In the 1800's linen was woven from flax and transported daily to Osmotherly by donkey for bleaching.
